results.title: Kita: or, What have you done for me lately?
results.creator_credit: William C. Jersey, Richard L. Wormser and BNA Films
results.brief_description: Frederick Herzberg points out that improvements in hygiene, wages, working conditions, and fringe benefits do not have a lasting effect on job motivation, and that the work people do is more important than how they are treated.

results.title: Kingfisher
results.creator_credit: Geoff Moon, Gordon Ell and Bush Films
results.brief_description: Records the intimate life of the Pacific Sacred Kingfisher of Australia and New Zealand. The birds are viewed as they progress through a year of life - hunting, diving for fish, courting and mating, boring nest tunnels, and the feeding and care of the young.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoff Moon, Gordon Ell and Bush Films

results.title: King Zog and the energy crunch
results.brief_description: A puppet animation in which King Zog learns to use his brains instead of scarce energy. The palace sorcerer shows how to make Zog’s palace energy efficient. Featuring the Bob Brown Marionettes.

results.title: King Oscar story
results.brief_description: Present the year round activities of a large Norwegian fishing company. The fleets follow the seasonal movements of salmon, herring and brisling; various methods of harvesting fish are shown. Factories near the fishing grounds clean, process and can the fish. The company produces its own cans and packaging and maintains a testing laboratory.

results.title: King of diamonds
results.brief_description: Traces the history of diamond mining in South Africa, showing scenes inside diamond mines. Provides an insight into the work required to convert the raw stones into sparkling precious gems.

results.title: King George V
results.brief_description: The history of a celebrated steam locomotive - the King George V - which was designed by Great Western Railways to represent Britain in the Fair of the Iron Horse in Baltimore, 1927.

results.title: Kimberley country
results.brief_description:
Kimberley country music has its own unique style and is promoted each year through the Derby Country Music Festival where musicians from as far as Halls Creek, Fitzroy Crossing, Port Hedland and the desert area of the Kimberleys gather together and compete in the Festival Talent Quest. The Country Music Festival, through organisers such as Pam Masters (Festival Committee Member) and Cyril Archer (Festival Talent Quest
Co-ordinator), provides assistance and support to aspiring indigenous singers, songwriters and musicians. Geoffrey Fletcher, Kathleen Cox and Ashley Oobagooma talk about their background, their family and their passion for music as they each prepare for the journey to Derby and the Festival. The film concludes with performances by each of these three musicians at the Festival along with footage of the Benning Brothers, Fitzroy Express, Pigram Brothers, Gulingi Nunga, Kevin Gunn and Lucy Cox on stage. Beautifully photographed, particularly of the Australian landscape, and interesting and entertaining interviews along with some great country music.

results.title: Killer track
results.brief_description: Deals with long distance runner Tony Rafferty and his attempt to run the Birdsville Track from Maree to Birdsville. Endeavours to explain Rafferty’s motivation and shows the stress involved and levels of endurance required for such a run.
